clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Two Analgesic Strategies After Scheduled Caesarean
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Two Analgesic Strategies After Scheduled Caesarean : Block of the Lumbar Region With Ropivacaine Versus Intrathecal Morphine

lead_sponsor.agency: GCS Ramsay Santé pour l'Enseignement et la Recherche

clinical_study.source: GCS Ramsay Santé pour l'Enseignement et la Recherche

brief_summary.textblock: To demonstrate the superiority of square lumbar block to ropivacaine compared to intrathecal morphine in the efficacy of postoperative analgesia following scheduled caesarean.

detailed_description.textblock: Interventional, comparative, randomized, controlled study versus reference therapeutic strategy, in 2 parallel groups, double-blind (patient and evaluator), single-center, aiming to demonstrate the superiority of ropivacaine in square lumbar block versus intrathecal morphine, on the efficacy of post-operative analgesia, following a scheduled caesarean.

primary_outcome.measure: Cumulative quantity of morphine received postoperatively via pump
primary_outcome.description: The main objective of the study is to demonstrate the superiority of square lumbar block to ropivacaine (quadratum lumburum block 2 - QLB2) in comparison to intrathecal morphine in the efficacy of postoperative analgesia following a scheduled Caesarean.

secondary_outcome.measure: Characteristics of postoperative pain using a visual analogic scale
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the characteristics of postoperative pain in both groups with the use of a visual analog scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Side effects of the two analgesic strategies
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate the side effects of the two analgesic strategies reported in a case report form

arm_group.description: Ropivacaine will be administrated in perineural in quadratum lumburum block 2 after the caesarian.
Morphine will be administrated in intrathecal

intervention.description: Administration of different anesthesia drugs in accordance with the courant practice (mixture of bupivacaine and sufentanil)
Subcutaneous injection of Sodium chloride at the usual quadratum lumburum block 2 (QLB2) injection site under ultrasound ("sham-QLB2").
